comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Toronto is misspelled. The 48th Highlanders of Canada is a Canadian Forces Primary Reserve (i.e., part-time militia) infantry regiment based in Toronto, parading out of Moss Park Armoury. The regiment is part of Land Force Central Area's 32 Canadian Brigade Group. 12th Infantry likely refers to ... The Sherbrooke Regiment (or Sherbrooke Hussars) was initially formed in 1866 as the Sherbrooke Battalion of Infantry, becoming the 53rd (Sherbrooke) Battalion in 1867. The regiment provided volunteers for the 12th Battalion, Canadian Expeditionary Force in 1914. Today's Royal Regiment of Canada (...) evolved from the 10th Royal Grenadiers and thus inherited British traditions.

comment.author: 92284803@N00
comment._content: This looks like two photos doctored into one shot. The column of marching soldiers seem like they're at a different scale than the column of soldiers behind them. Does anyone else see this? Or are my eyes deceiving me?

comment.author: 19418358@N00
comment._content: I'm confused as to why history would be falsely represented this way. What was the purpose to doctor in extra soldiers? Interesting indeed...

comment.author: 15283643@N04
comment._content:
"What was the purpose to doctor in extra soldiers?"

It gave the impression that everyone was eager to sign up. A bid to round up more cannon fodder. "C'mon lads! Get in line! Home by Christmas, we promise!"

comment.author: 10317187@N05
comment._content: One could also argue: "Figures in the background seem larger than they should. Especially on the left side."

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks trialsanderrors for catching the typo in the title and for the additional information about the 48th Highlanders. Thanks to all for pointing out that this photo is a composite of two images. Take a look at the higher resolution image: lcweb2.loc.gov/master/pnp/ggbain/16900/16977u.tif

comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: The full-sized version is now viewable as a jpeg on Wikimedia Commons: commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:48th_Highlanders,_12th_In... It's also interesting for other modifications beyond the cut-and-paste...
